thread.title: Stephen Colbert taking ‘Late Show’ live after Trump’s address to Congress
thread.title_full: Stephen Colbert taking ‘Late Show’ live after Trump’s address to Congress

author: Oliver Gettell
title: Stephen Colbert taking ‘Late Show’ live after Trump’s address to Congress
text:
Scott Kowalchyk/CBS via Getty Images 
Stephen Colbert is going off the cuff in honor of President Trump. 
CBS announced Friday that The Late Show With Stephen Colbert will broadcast a live episode following Trump’s first address to a joint session of Congress on Feb. 28. 
Actress Lisa Kudrow and former White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest will be Colbert’s guests. 
Colbert has enjoyed a ratings surge in the first weeks of Trump’s presidency, during which he has once again brandished the biting political comedy that was his trademark on The Daily Show and The Colbert Report . 
Feb. 28 will mark Colbert’s 14th time going live on The Late Show . He previously did so in July during the Republican and Democratic conventions, and after the presidential debates between Trump and Hillary Clinton in September and October. Colbert also hosted a live election night special on Showtime, a corporate sibling of CBS. 
The Late Show airs weeknights at 11:35 p.m. ET on CBS. Show Full Article
